steps.title: What kind of event is it?
steps.content: Start by choosing the type of event you are planning

steps.title: Who will be booking on to the event?
steps.content: This allows you to choose what the default is for participants when they book on. The most common default is 'attendee'.

steps.title: Participant Listing
steps.content: This enables you to publish the list of attendees if you are organising a high profile event. Usually, you will want this to be disabled.

steps.title: Title
steps.content: This is the public title for your event

steps.title: The Summary
steps.content: This will be displayed alongside the description below. If you use an RSS feed or a View, for example, you may restrict the display to the summary

steps.title: Add a full description
steps.content: This is where you can add a full description and use all the formatting options

steps.title: Dates
steps.content: Make sure you complete start and end dates, otherwise the event will continue to be current

steps.title: Manage your waiting list
steps.content: If you specify a maximum here, this will enable the waiting list option and you can control the message that goes out when it's full

steps.title: Additional Options
steps.content: Towards the bottom here, you have some more options to add a map, choose whether it is active or inactive, public or hidden, and whether there are options to share the event with shortcuts on social media

steps.title: And finally...
steps.content: When you click on Continue, this will save the event and then allow you to add extras, such as the address, online booking, payments, or add linked events.
